StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Human skin metagenome associated with acne

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: Funding support for the study of the Human Skin Metagenome Associated with Acne was provided by NIAMS (UH2 AR057503) and NIGMS (R01 GM099530). The datasets used for the analyses described in this manuscript were obtained from dbGaP https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap (please be sure to reference the dbGaP accession number of all datasets used). The data were provided by Dr. Huiying Li on behalf of her collaborators at the University of California, Los Angeles and Los Angeles Biomedical Research Institute at Harbor-UCLA Medical Center. Dr. Li and her collaborators request that publications resulting from these data cite their original publication: Barnard, E. et al. The balance of metagenomic elements shapes the skin microbiome in acne and health. Sci. Rep. 6, 39491; doi: 10.1038/srep39491 (2016).

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Human Microbiome Research)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-HMP
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Human Microbiome Research.
These data may be used only for studies related to the human microbiome. Sequence data generated from microbiome samples will be used only for the purpose of studying the microbial components of the microbiome and will not be used to make inferences about the human host DNA itself.
